headers.subject: Re: [haXe] Norton Problem

body.para: Who told that "scan your computer and you're safe?" And how much do they sold their software?
On Thu, Apr 16, 2009 at 3:46 PM, Tony Polinelli <tonyp@touchmypixel.com> wrote:

quote.quotepara: This is when compiling your lib out of flash cs3
On Thu, Apr 16, 2009 at 11:46 PM, Tony Polinelli <tonyp@touchmypixel.com> wrote:
AHAH... ok ok.. here we go

I've figured out a quick fix. Put on stage a dynamic textfield in your library that embeds characters from an OpenType font (not ttf i think) - try "Calibri" for instance, and embedd it for runtime access. This will trick the virus checking out of thinking you have a virus (from my tests)... good work Norton!
On Thu, Apr 16, 2009 at 11:37 PM, Robin Palotai <palotai.robin@gmail.com> wrote:
Or maybe is there a buffer overflow somewhere in the assembled code unintentionally? Could an awf file cause such thing (with a theoretically non-buggy flash player)?
How do we know if this warning is the result of a heuristic pattern matching, or a runtime overflow detection?
On Thu, Apr 16, 2009 at 3:30 PM, Tony Polinelli <tonyp@touchmypixel.com> wrote:

i just spent the last 20 mins on a chat to someone from Norton who may aswell have been a computer. He just assured me every second line that if i scan with Norton, then i am safe - no way i could file a report on a false detection. This doesnt help I will find what needs to be in you swf-lib to avoid it - as a temporary patch.. fun
Nicholas- sorry to reiterate - but are we 110% sure that it isnt infecfted in any way - i remember that the windows exe was infected with something for the 2.03 download (apprarantly)
On Thu, Apr 16, 2009 at 11:04 PM, Tony Polinelli <tonyp@touchmypixel.com> wrote:

I have found that it occurs with NO swf lib.. with the swf-lib for the container (very basic) it occurs... with the swf-lib for my site.. it doesnt occur.. must have something in the lib (generated from flash that overrides or confuses it)
On Thu, Apr 16, 2009 at 10:47 PM, Nicolas Cannasse <ncannasse@motion-twin.com> wrote:

It it interesting - i cant compiler the container swf for the site from FlashDevelop without it finding something - but i can the site.. i have removed all classes and have an empty main() and it still finds it (detects the "virus" in the tmp file FD creates)- going to keep tracking
Does it occurs without any class compiled and without any SWF library ?
